# Administrative Decision No. (933) of 2025
The Undersecretary of the Ministry of Commerce and Industry
Having reviewed:
- Decree-Law No. (43) of 1964 concerning importation and its executive regulations.
- And upon Decree-Law No. (10) of 1979 concerning the supervision of trade in goods, the pricing of some of them, and artisanal works and the pricing of some of them, and its amendments.
- And upon Decree-Law No. (68) of 1980 promulgating the Commercial Law, and its amending laws.
- And upon Decree No. (191) of 2015 concerning the organization of the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig>.
- And upon Ministerial Resolution No. (216) of 2014 issuing the Executive Regulations for Law No. (117) of 2013, which amended some provisions of Decree-Law No. (10) of 1979.
- And upon Ministerial Resolution No. (43) of 2025 concerning the delegation of certain powers to the Undersecretary of the Ministry.
- And upon the letter from the Public Authority for Food and Nutrition <orig>الهيئة العامة للغذاء والتغذية</orig> No. (1065) dated 14/5/2025 concerning the recommendations of meeting No. (3/2025).
- And based on the requirements of the public interest.
It is decided
## Article One
To lift the ban on the following food products:
1. Snickers protein bars
2. Mars protein bars
3. Bounty protein bars
4. Milky way protein bars

All competent authorities, each within its jurisdiction, shall implement this decision. It shall be effective from the date of its issuance and shall be published in the Official Gazette.
Undersecretary of the Ministry of Commerce and Industry

# Administrative Decision No. (969) of 2025

The Undersecretary of the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وكيل وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig>

Having reviewed:
- Decree-Law No. (43) of 1964 concerning importation and its executive regulations.
- And upon Decree-Law No. (10) of 1979 concerning the supervision of trade in goods, the pricing of some of them, and artisanal works and the pricing of some of them, and its amendments.
- And upon Decree-Law No. (68) of 1980 promulgating the Commercial Law, and its amending laws.
- And upon Decree No. (191) of 2015 regarding the organization of the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig>.
- And upon Ministerial Resolution No. (216) of 2014 issuing the Executive Regulations for Law No. (117) of 2013, which amended some provisions of Decree-Law No. (10) of 1979.
- And upon Ministerial Resolution No. (43) of 2025 regarding the delegation of certain powers to the Undersecretary of the Ministry.
- And upon the letter from the Public Authority for Food and Nutrition <orig>الهيئة العامة للغذاء والتغذية</orig> No. (1240) dated 28/5/2025, regarding the recommendations of meeting No. (5/2025).
- And based on the requirements of the public interest.

Has Decided

### Article One
A ban on the import of all types of poultry meat (fresh, chilled, frozen, processed), its derivatives, products, and table eggs from the Czech Republic due to the outbreak of highly pathogenic avian influenza.

### Article Two
Exempted from the temporary ban stipulated in the first clause are poultry meat, table eggs, and their products that have undergone heat treatment sufficient to eliminate the highly pathogenic avian influenza virus, provided they comply with approved health requirements and standard specifications, and are accompanied by a health certificate issued by the official authorities accredited in the aforementioned country, proving that the product is free from the causative agent of the disease or that it has been eliminated.

### Article Three
All competent authorities, each within its jurisdiction, shall implement this decision. It shall come into effect from the date of its issuance and shall be published in the Official Gazette / Al-Jarida Al-Rasmiya <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>.

Undersecretary of the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وكيل وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig>

Issued on: 27 May 2025

# Ministry of Social Affairs <orig>وزارة الشئون الاجتماعية</orig>
## Ministerial Resolution No. (197) of 2024
Regarding the appointment of a temporary board of directors for the Kuwait Red Crescent Society <orig>جمعية الهلال الأحمر الكويتي</orig>
The Minister of Social Affairs and Family and Childhood Affairs:
* Having reviewed Law No. 24 of 1962 concerning clubs and public benefit associations and its amending laws.
* And upon Decree No. (50) of 2017 concerning the Ministry of Social Affairs <orig>وزارة الشئون الاجتماعية</orig>.
* And upon Ministerial Resolution No. (38) of 1966 promulgating the Kuwait Red Crescent Society <orig>جمعية الهلال الأحمر الكويتي</orig>.
* And upon Ministerial Resolution (61) of 2005 concerning the model articles of association for public benefit associations.
* And upon Ministerial Resolution No. (112) of 2009 amending the articles of association of the Kuwait Red Crescent Society <orig>جمعية الهلال الأحمر الكويتي</orig>.
* And upon Ministerial Resolution No. (46/A) of 2020 concerning the mechanism and controls for supervising the work of public benefit associations and charitable endowments.
* And given the expiration of the term of the board of directors of the Kuwait Red Crescent Society <orig>جمعية الهلال الأحمر الكويتي</orig>.
* And based on the requirements of the public interest.
### Article (1)
A temporary board of directors shall be appointed for the Kuwait Red Crescent Society <orig>جمعية الهلال الأحمر الكويتي</orig> for a period of one year, renewable.
Chaired by Mr. Khaled Mohammed Sulaiman Mohammed Al-Mughamis <orig>خالد محمد سليمان محمد المغامس</orig>, with the membership of:
1- Hamoud Hamad Ali Al-Sane <orig>حمود حمد علي الصانع</orig>.
2. Yousef Abdullah Abdulaziz Yousef Abdulrahman Al-Zain <orig>يوسف عبد الله عبد العزيز يوسف عبد الرحمن الزين</orig>.
3- Fahad Ahmed Al-Mandeel <orig>فهد أحمد المنديل</orig>.
4- Saud Abdulrahman Saud Al-Mekhaizeem <orig>سعود عبد الرحمن سعود المخيزيم</orig>.
### Article (2)
The previous board of directors of the society, whose term has expired, must hand over the headquarters, funds, and all documents and papers related to the society to the temporary board of directors, by virtue of official records, within three days from the date of issuance of this resolution.
### Article (3)
The temporary board of directors shall assume all the powers and authorities of the board of directors stipulated in the aforementioned Law No. 21 of 1962 and the society's articles of association.
### Article (5)
This resolution shall be published in the Official Gazette and shall come into effect from the date of its issuance.
Minister of Social Affairs and Family and Childhood Affairs
Dr. Amthal Hadi Al-Huwailah <orig>أمثال هادي الحويلة</orig>
Issued on: 26 Rabi' al-Awwal 1446 H
Corresponding to: 29 September 2024 G

### Article Five

### Article Six
The competent authorities shall implement this resolution, each within its jurisdiction. It shall come into effect as of (2025/07/13) and shall be published in the Official Gazette.

# Public Authority for Manpower
## Ministerial Decision No. (4) of 2025 Amending Certain Provisions of Ministerial Decision No. (3) of 2024 Regarding the Mechanism for Granting Work Permits, the Transfer of Labor Recruited with Work Permits, and the Prescribed Fees

The First Deputy Prime Minister and Minister of Interior:
- Having reviewed Law No. (28) of 1969 regarding labor in the oil business sector,
- And Law No. (6) of 2010 regarding labor in the private sector, and its amendments,
- And Law No. (109) of 2013 regarding the Public Authority for Manpower,
- And Decree No. (153) of 2022 transferring the supervision of the Public Authority for Manpower,
- And Ministerial Decision No. (2) of 2023 assigning the Director General of the Public Authority for Manpower,
- And the Public Authority for Manpower Decision No. (842) of 2015 regarding the conditions for the transfer of labor from one employer to another, and its amending decisions,
- And the regulations on the rules and procedures for granting work permits issued under the Public Authority for Manpower Decision No. (156) of 2022 and its amending decisions,
- And Ministerial Decision No. (3) of 2024 regarding the mechanism for granting work permits, the transfer of labor recruited with work permits, and the prescribed fees,
- And upon the presentation by the Director General of the Public Authority for Manpower,
- And based on the requirements of the work interest.

Has decided

### Article One
The provisions of the aforementioned Ministerial Decision No. (3) of 2024 shall remain in effect.

### Article Two
The second and fifth articles of the aforementioned Ministerial Decision No. (3) of 2024 are hereby repealed.

### Article Three
This decision shall take effect from the date of its issuance and shall be published in the Official Gazette. The competent authorities shall be informed and shall implement its provisions.

First Deputy Prime Minister
and Minister of Interior
**Fahad Yousuf Saud Al-Sabah <orig>فهد يوسف سعود الصباح</orig>**

Issued on: 2 June 2025 AD

# Ministry of Information <orig>وزارة الإعلام</orig>
## Announcement
The Ministry of Information <orig>وزارة الإعلام</orig> announces the issuance of Tender No. W/M/919/2025-2026 for the supply of flower bouquets for the offices of the Minister and the Undersecretary at the Ministry of Information. This is in accordance with the technical terms and specifications contained in the tender documents, which can be purchased from the Ministry of Information's website via the QR code attached to this announcement, starting from Sunday, 15/06/2025, for a non-refundable fee of (30 K.D.) only thirty Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>. Bids must be submitted to the Procurement Department at the Ministry of Information in sealed envelopes, accompanied by a preliminary insurance of (2%) of the bid value (which must be valid for the entire 90-day bid validity period). The tender number, as indicated above, must be written on the outside of the envelope, avoiding any mention of the bidder's name or any identifying marks. The deadline for bid submission is 1:00 PM on Tuesday, 01/07/2025.
- All documents must be submitted on 3 non-copyable CDs, with the exception of the bid form, the preliminary insurance, a copy of the purchase receipt, and the bidder's information form.
- The tender is indivisible, and alternative bids will not be accepted.
- This announcement serves as an invitation for interested bidders to attend the envelope-opening session, after coordinating with the Procurement Department before the scheduled date for the bid-opening session.
- A valid certificate of national labor percentage compliance, issued by the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig>, must be submitted with the bid. Please note that bids not including this certificate will be disqualified.
- The bidder must attach a valid "To Whom It May Concern" certificate issued by the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig> stating that there are no holds on the bidder's file for government contracts registered with the Authority due to any of the violations mentioned in Article 10 of Law No. 6 of 2010 regarding labor in the private sector. Please note that bids not including this certificate will be disqualified.
- Owners of small and medium-sized enterprises are exempt from the fees for purchasing the documents, in accordance with the provisions of Article 39 of Law No. 74/2019 concerning amendments to Law No. 49 of 2016.
- Owners of small and medium-sized enterprises wishing to participate in the tender must attach to their bid a valid certificate issued by the National Fund for Small and Medium Enterprise Development <orig>الصندوق الوطني لرعاية وتنمية المشروعات الصغيرة والمتوسطة</orig> certifying their status as a small or medium enterprise.
- This announcement is an integral part of the tender documents.
- To obtain a copy, the bidder must register and pay the fees through the website https://eservice.media.gov.kw/purchase/

# Ministry of Islamic Affairs <orig>وزارة الشئون الإسلامية</orig>
## Announcement
Regarding Tender No. A.Y.10-2024 concerning the provision of a financial program for managing support projects for the General Secretariat of Awqaf <orig>الأمانة العامة للأوقاف</orig> (financial - administrative - projects) (to be deducted from the support of the General Secretariat of Awqaf <orig>الأمانة العامة للأوقاف</orig>)
With reference to the above subject and to the announcement issued on Sunday, 25/5/2025, regarding the aforementioned tender, please be advised that the preliminary meeting will be held on Wednesday, 18/6/2025, at 10:00 AM in the meeting hall of the Engineering Affairs Department. Additionally, the closing date has been extended to Wednesday, 25/6/2025.

843% of the total shares of the company's capital, which amounts to 404,568,117 shares.
After announcing the completion of the legal quorum for the company's Extraordinary General Assembly meeting, Mr. Abdulhussein Saleh Al-Sultan <orig>عبدالحسين صالح السلطان</orig> – Chairman of the Board of Directors, opened the meeting session by welcoming the attendees. He then proceeded to present the items on the agenda of the Extraordinary General Assembly for discussion, and the following was resolved:
1- Approval to increase the company's authorized, issued, and paid-up capital from 40,456,811.700 K.D. to 44,502,492.800 K.D. by an amount of 4,045,681.000, representing a 10% bonus share issue, to be allocated to the shareholders registered in the records at the end of the entitlement day, which is set for one month after the date of the General Assembly meeting, and to authorize the Board of Directors to dispose of any share fractions, if any.
2- Approval to amend Article (7) of the Memorandum of Association and Article (6) of the Articles of Association related to the capital, previously amended and noted in the Commercial Register under the memorandum of the Department of Shareholding Companies No. 116 dated 1/7/2015, based on the resolution of the Extraordinary General Assembly held on 10/6/2015, to become as follows, after obtaining the approval of the competent authorities:
(Text before amendment)
The company's authorized, issued, and paid-up capital is set at 40,456,811.700 K.D. (forty million, four hundred fifty-six thousand, eight hundred eleven Kuwaiti Dinars and seven hundred fils), divided into 404,568,117 shares (four hundred four million, five hundred sixty-eight thousand, one hundred seventeen shares), with a value of (100) one hundred Kuwaiti fils per share, and all shares are cash shares.
(Text after amendment)
The company's authorized, issued, and paid-up capital is set at 44,502,492.800 K.D. (forty-four million, five hundred two thousand, four hundred ninety-two Kuwaiti Dinars and eight hundred fils), divided into 445,024,928 shares (four hundred forty-five million, twenty-four thousand, nine hundred twenty-eight shares), with a value of (100) one hundred Kuwaiti fils per share, and all shares are cash shares.
The proceedings of the Extraordinary General Assembly concluded at exactly eleven-thirty in the morning on the same day. At the end of the meeting, Mr. Abdulhussein Saleh Al-Sultan <orig>عبدالحسين صالح السلطان</orig> – Chairman of the Assembly and Chairman of the Board of Directors, thanked the shareholders.

# United Oil Projects Company (Closed) <orig>الشركة المتحدة للمشروعات النفطية (مقفلة)</orig>
## Minutes of the Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting for the year 2025
### Held on Sunday, May 25, 2025

The Extraordinary General Assembly of the shareholders of the United Oil Projects Company <orig>الشركة المتحدة للمشروعات النفطية</orig> – a Kuwaiti Shareholding Company (Closed) <orig>شركة مساهمة كويتية (مقفلة)</orig>, held its meeting for the year 2025 at ten-thirty in the morning on Sunday, May 25, 2025, at the Business Center – 54th Floor – KIPCO Tower – located in the Sharq area.
The meeting was chaired by Sheikh / Sabah Mohammed Abdulaziz Al-Sabah <orig>الشيخ / صباح محمد عبد العزيز الصباح</orig> – Chairman of the Board of Directors. The meeting was also attended by:
Shareholders holding 83,998,103 shares, in person and by proxy, representing 84.78% of the total outstanding shares of the issued and paid-up capital of 100,000,000 shares.
After announcing that the legal quorum for the validity of the Extraordinary General Assembly meeting was met,
Sheikh / Sabah Mohammed Abdulaziz Al-Sabah <orig>الشيخ / صباح محمد عبد العزيز الصباح</orig> – Chairman of the Assembly, opened the meeting by welcoming the attendees, then proceeded to review and discuss the items on the agenda: -
Approval to amend the text of Article (47) of the company's Articles of Association to become as follows:

Text of Article (47) before amendment: The net profits shall be distributed as follows
a- A percentage of not less than ten percent of the net profits shall be deducted annually, by a resolution of the Ordinary General Assembly based on a proposal from the Board of Directors, to form a statutory reserve for the company.
The Assembly may suspend this deduction if the statutory reserve exceeds half of the company's issued capital.
b- A percentage shall be deducted annually from the gross profits, to be determined by the Board of Directors after consulting the auditor, for the depreciation of the company's assets or to compensate for their decrease in value. These funds shall be used to purchase necessary materials, machinery, and facilities or for their repair, and these funds may not be distributed to the shareholders.
c- The Ordinary General Assembly must decide to deduct a percentage of the profits to meet the obligations incumbent upon the company under labor and social security laws.
A special fund may be established to assist the company's workers and employees.
d- A percentage not exceeding ten percent of the net profits may be deducted annually, by a resolution of the Ordinary General Assembly based on a proposal from the Board of Directors, to form a voluntary reserve allocated for purposes determined by the Assembly.
e- The Ordinary General Assembly may, based on a proposal from the Board of Directors, distribute profits to the shareholders at the end of the fiscal year, provided that such distribution is from actual profits, in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles, and that this distribution does not affect the company's paid-up capital.

Text of Article (47) after amendment: The net profits shall be distributed as follows
1. A percentage of not less than ten percent of the net profits shall be deducted annually, by a resolution of the Ordinary General Assembly based on a proposal from the Board of Directors, to form a statutory reserve for the company. The General Assembly may suspend this deduction if the statutory reserve exceeds half of the company's capital.
2. 1% shall be deducted and allocated to the account of the Kuwait Foundation for the Advancement of Sciences <orig>مؤسسة الكويت للتقدم العلمي</orig>.
3. A percentage not exceeding ten percent of the net profits may be deducted annually, by a resolution of the Ordinary General Assembly based on a proposal from the Board of Directors, to form a voluntary reserve allocated for purposes determined by the Assembly.
4. A portion of the profits, determined by the General Assembly, shall be deducted to meet the obligations incumbent upon the company under labor laws, and these funds may not be distributed to the shareholders.
5. The amount necessary to distribute a first dividend of (5%) five percent to the shareholders from the value of their shares shall be deducted.
6. After the foregoing, an amount determined by the Ordinary General Assembly, not to exceed (10%) ten percent of the remainder, shall be deducted and allocated for the remuneration of the Board of Directors.
7. The remainder of the profits shall then be distributed to the shareholders as an additional share of the profits, or carried forward to the next year upon the proposal of the Board of Directors, or allocated to establish a general reserve fund or an extraordinary depreciation fund.
8. The Ordinary General Assembly may, based on a proposal from the Board of Directors, distribute profits to the shareholders at the end of the fiscal year, provided that such distribution is from actual profits, in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles, and that this distribution does not affect the company's paid-up capital.
9. A percentage shall be deducted annually from the gross profits, to be determined by the Board of Directors after consulting the auditor, for the depreciation of the company's assets or to compensate for their decrease in value. These funds shall be used to purchase necessary materials, machinery, and facilities or for their repair, and these funds may not be distributed to the shareholders.
10. The Ordinary General Assembly must decide to deduct a percentage of the profits to meet the obligations incumbent upon the company under labor and social security laws.
A special fund may be established to assist the company's workers and employees.
At the end of the meeting, Sheikh / Sabah Mohammed Abdulaziz Al-Sabah <orig>الشيخ / صباح محمد عبد العزيز الصباح</orig> – Chairman
<page_end>53</page_end>

# Kuwaiti Furniture Manufacturing and Trading Company K.S.C.
## Minutes of the Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting
### Held on Wednesday, May 28, 2025

The Extraordinary General Assembly meeting of the Kuwaiti Furniture Manufacturing and Trading Company K.S.C. (Closed) – KUFUMA was held at 11:00 AM on Wednesday, 28/5/2025, on the 50th floor – KIPCO Tower – Khalid Bin Al Waleed Street – Block 5 – Sharq area.
The meeting was chaired by Mr. Khalid Abduljabbar Al-Sharad <orig>خالد عبد الجبار الشراد</orig>, "Vice Chairman of the Board of Directors". The meeting was also attended by:
- Dr. Ali Owaid Rekhais <orig>علي عويد رخيص</orig> – the company's auditor from Al-Waha Auditing Office.
- Shareholders holding 10,000,000 shares by proxy, representing 100% of the company's total issued and paid-up share capital of 1,000,000/- Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>.
- Mr. Fahad Abdulrahman Al-Bediwi <orig>فهد عبدالرحمن البديوي</orig> – representative of the Gulf Custody Company.
After announcing that the legal quorum for the validity of the Extraordinary General Assembly meeting was met, Mr. Khalid Abduljabbar Al-Sharad <orig>خالد عبد الجبار الشراد</orig> – Chairman of the Extraordinary General Assembly – opened the meeting, welcoming the attendees. The items on the agenda were then reviewed and discussed, and the following was approved and ratified by unanimous consent of those present:
First: Approval was granted to amend Article (14) of the company's Articles of Association concerning the number of members of the company's Board of Directors, as follows:
Text before amendment:
The company shall be managed by a Board of Directors composed of three members elected by the General Assembly by secret ballot.
Text after amendment:
The company shall be managed by a Board of Directors composed of (5) members (five members) elected by the General Assembly by secret ballot. Any shareholder, whether a natural or legal person, may appoint representatives to the company's Board of Directors in proportion to the shares they own. The number of board members selected in this manner shall be deducted from the total number of board members to be elected. Shareholders who have representatives on the Board of Directors may not participate with other shareholders in electing the remaining members of the Board of Directors, except to the extent of the shares exceeding the percentage used to appoint their representatives on the Board. A group of shareholders may form an alliance among themselves to appoint one or more representatives to the Board of Directors in proportion to their combined ownership. The term of membership on the Board shall be three years, renewable.
At the end of the meeting, Mr. Khalid Abduljabbar Al-Sharad <orig>خالد عبد الجبار الشراد</orig> – Chairman of the Extraordinary General Assembly – thanked the attendees.
The meeting concluded at 11:10 AM on the same day.
Vice Chairman of the Board of Directors

# United Buildings Company (K.S.C.) Closed
## Minutes of the Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting
### Held on Tuesday, 27/05/2025

The Extraordinary General Assembly of United Buildings Company (K.S.C.) Closed held its meeting at 12:00 PM on Tuesday, 27/05/2025, at the headquarters of the parent company (United Real Estate Company (K.S.C.P.)) in Sharq – Khalid Bin Al Waleed Street – Al Shaheed Tower – 7th Floor.
The meeting was chaired by Sheikh/ Sabah Mohammed Abdulaziz Al-Sabah <orig>صباح محمد عبد العزيز الصباح</orig>, "Chairman of the Board of Directors". The meeting was also attended by:
- Mr. Yousef Al-Awadhi <orig>يوسف العوضي</orig> from the company's auditor's office (Ernst & Young) – Al-Aiban, Al-Osaimi & Partners.
- Mr. Abdo Salama Al-Dhab' <orig>عبده سلامة الضبع</orig> (representing the minority stake) on behalf of the shareholder Tamleek United Real Estate Services Company (W.L.L.), shareholder number: 00000809378, holding 100,000 shares.
- Mr. El-Sayed Abdel Aziz Ali <orig>السيد عبد العزيز علي</orig> (Secretary of the Assembly).
The meeting was attended by shareholders holding (100%) of the company's shares by proxy. After announcing that the legal quorum for the validity of the Extraordinary General Assembly meeting was met, Sheikh/ Sabah Mohammed Abdulaziz Al-Sabah <orig>صباح محمد عبد العزيز الصباح</orig>, "Chairman of the Assembly," opened the meeting, welcoming the attendees. The items on the agenda were then reviewed and discussed, and the following was approved and ratified:–
- Approval to amend Article (5) of the Memorandum of Association and the text of Article (4) of the Articles of Association of United Buildings Company (K.S.C. Closed):
1- Amending the text of Article (5) of the Memorandum of Association and the text of Article (4) of the Articles of Association to read as follows:
Text before amendment:
The purposes for which the company was established are:
1- Undertaking construction contracting works for buildings, roads, and bridges, and their management and supervision.
2- Manufacturing and producing various types of building materials, subject to the approval of the Public Authority for Industry <orig>الهيئة العامة للصناعة</orig>.
3- Trading and packaging of cement, sand, and related bulk materials.
4- Manufacturing and executing paint and decoration works necessary for civil works (subject to the approval of the Public Authority for Industry <orig>الهيئة العامة للصناعة</orig>).
5- Representing companies and entering into tenders related to these purposes.
6- Owning movable and real properties necessary to conduct its activities within the limits permitted by law.
7- Utilizing the company's surplus funds by investing them in financial portfolios managed by specialized companies and entities.
8- Owning, selling, buying, and developing real estate and land for the company's account inside and outside the State of Kuwait, as well as managing third-party properties, all in a manner that does not violate the provisions of existing laws and the prohibitions on trading in private housing plots as stipulated by these laws.
9- Owning, selling, and buying shares and bonds of real estate companies for the company's account only, in Kuwait and abroad.
10- Preparing studies and providing consultations in all types of real estate fields, provided that the required conditions are met by those who practice this service.
11- Carrying out maintenance works related to buildings and properties owned by the company and by others, including maintenance and execution of civil, mechanical, electrical, elevator, and air conditioning works, to ensure the preservation and safety of the buildings.
12- Organizing real estate exhibitions for the company's real estate projects, in accordance with the regulations in force at the Ministry.
13- Direct contribution to developing the infrastructure for residential, commercial, and industrial areas and projects under the "Build-Operate-Transfer" (BOT) system, and managing real estate facilities under the "BOT" system.

Text before amendment:
The company shall be managed by a Board of Directors composed of (5 members) five members, and the term of membership shall be three years, renewable.
Any shareholder, whether a natural or legal person, may appoint representatives to the company's Board of Directors in proportion to the shares they own. The number of Board members selected in this manner shall be deducted from the total number of Board members to be elected. Shareholders who have representatives on the Board of Directors may not participate with other shareholders in electing the remaining members of the Board, except to the extent that exceeds the percentage used to appoint their representatives on the Board. A group of shareholders may form an alliance among themselves to appoint one or more representatives on their behalf to the Board of Directors in proportion to their collective ownership.
These representatives shall have the same rights and duties as elected members, and the shareholder shall be responsible for the actions of their representatives towards the company, its creditors, and its shareholders.

After discussion, the following resolution was adopted:
Approval and ratification were given to amend the text of Article (5) of the company's Memorandum of Association and Article (4) of the Articles of Association concerning the current purposes of the company, as follows:

- **Text of the Article before amendment:**
The purposes for which the company was established are as follows:
1. Owning, selling, purchasing, and developing real estate and land for the company's account inside and outside the State of Kuwait, as well as managing third-party properties, all in a manner that does not violate the provisions stipulated in existing laws and the prohibition on trading in private housing plots as stipulated by these laws.
2. Owning, selling, and purchasing shares and bonds of real estate companies for the company's account only in Kuwait and abroad.
3. Preparing studies and providing consultations in all types of real estate fields, provided that the required conditions are met by those who practice this service.
4. Owning and managing hotels, health clubs, and tourist facilities, and leasing and renting them.
5. Carrying out maintenance work related to buildings and properties owned by the company and by others, including maintenance work and the execution of civil, mechanical, and electrical works, elevators, and air conditioning, to ensure the preservation and safety of the buildings.
6. Managing, operating, investing in, leasing, and renting hotels, clubs, motels, guesthouses, rest houses, parks, gardens, restaurants, cafeterias, residential complexes, tourist and health resorts, recreational and sports projects, and shops of various grades and levels, including all original and ancillary services, attached facilities, and other necessary services.
7. Organizing real estate exhibitions for the company's real estate projects, in accordance with the regulations in force at the Ministry.
8. Holding real estate auctions, in accordance with the regulations in force at the Ministry.
9. Owning and managing commercial markets and residential complexes.
10. Utilizing the company's available financial surpluses by investing them in financial portfolios managed by specialized companies and entities.
11. Direct contribution to establishing the infrastructure for residential, commercial, and industrial areas and projects under the Build-Operate-Transfer (BOT) system, and managing real estate facilities under the BOT system.

The company may directly carry out the aforementioned activities in the State of Kuwait and abroad, either on its own behalf or as an agent. The company may have an interest in or associate in any way with entities that engage in activities similar to its own or that may assist it in achieving its objectives in Kuwait or abroad. It may also establish, participate in, purchase, or annex such entities.

- **Text of the Article after amendment:**

14. Recreation parks, beaches, and coasts – Activity Code (932901).

The company may directly carry out the aforementioned activities in the State of Kuwait and abroad, either on its own behalf or as an agent. # Ministry of Education <orig>وزارة التربية</orig>
## Announcement
### Practice No. MM / 23 / 2024 – 2025
Operation, repair, and maintenance of the bowling system, surveillance and sound systems, and uninterruptible power supplies in schools and buildings belonging to the Ministry of Education in the Capital Educational Area
The Ministry of Education <orig>وزارة التربية</orig> announces a (public) practice for the operation, repair, and maintenance of the bowling system, surveillance and sound systems, and uninterruptible power supplies in schools and buildings belonging to the Ministry of Education in the Capital Educational Area, in accordance with the terms and technical specifications in the practice documents.
**General Guidelines for the Practice:**
1- The practice is (public) for practitioners accredited by the Ministry of Education <orig>وزارة التربية</orig>.
2- Applicants for this practice must be institutions/companies specialized in the work subject of the practice within Kuwait, registered in the Commercial Register and the Kuwait Chamber of Commerce and Industry for the current year, and must attach a certificate to that effect with their bid, dated concurrently with the date of the practice announcement.
3- This practice is (indivisible), and the bidder is not entitled to submit alternative offers.
4- The fee for obtaining a copy of the practice documents is (75) seventy-five Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> only.
5- The bid must be accompanied by a preliminary security deposit of not less than (KWD 2,000/---), two thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> only. This security must be in the form of a certified check or a letter of guarantee from a bank accredited in the State of Kuwait, issued in the name of the bidder and for the benefit of the Ministry of Education <orig>وزارة التربية</orig>, and must be unconditional. Bids not accompanied by this security, or accompanied by a security that violates any of the aforementioned controls, will be disregarded. The security must be valid for the required validity period of the bid.
6- The total duration of the contract is 730 days from the date of signing the contract, during which the contractor is obligated to execute the practice works in accordance with the general and special conditions, provisions, and technical specifications contained in the practice documents.
7- The bidder agrees that their bid shall remain valid and in effect, irrevocable, and cannot be withdrawn from the time of its submission until the end of its validity period. No price reduction will be considered after the bid has been submitted.
8- If, upon studying the practice, the practitioner finds any error, omission, or discrepancy in the technical documents or bills of quantities that affects the categories of their bid or the value of the works, they must seek clarification from the Ministry of Education <orig>وزارة التربية</orig> before submitting their bid. The Ministry will study these observations and inquiries, respond to them, and rectify any error, omission, discrepancy, or conflict (if any). This shall not result in any additional responsibility or obligation on the part of the Ministry.
9- The practice documents must be deposited in the tender box at the Supplies and Warehouses Department in the South Subhan <orig>صبحان الجنوبي</orig> area during official working hours, no later than (10) ten days from the date of this announcement's publication, at exactly (12:00 PM), in accordance with the decision issued by the Ministry regarding any change or extension of the closing date. No bid received after the specified closing time will be accepted, nor will any modification to the prices of submitted bids be considered after the bid has been submitted.

The Ministry has the right not to accept the bid unless it includes the filling of the tables in accordance with the public interest, with the necessity of adhering to what is stated in the specifications and technical conditions of the practice.
11- The practitioner must submit all bank guarantees for this practice in the Arabic language.

## Record of Announcement of Sale of Seized Items
The Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig> – Capital Enforcement Department <orig>إدارة التنفيذ العاصمة</orig> – Compulsory Enforcement Department <orig>قسم التنفيذ الجبري</orig> – announces that on Wednesday, 12/6/2025, the movable assets of the judgment debtor, KCC Engineering and Contracting Company (K.S.C) Closed <orig>شركة كي سي سي للهندسة والمقاولات (ش.م.ك) مقفلة</orig>, will be sold by public auction. The sale will take place at the following address: Shuaiba Industrial West <orig>شعيبة الصناعية الغربية</orig> area – Block (11) – Plot (11) – PACI No. (96245001) – in satisfaction of the amount of (1,264,016.670 K.D. <orig>د.ك</orig>).
If this day is not sufficient to complete the sale, it will be completed on the following three days. Those interested in purchasing should be present at the time and place specified above. For more information, please visit the Compulsory Enforcement Department <orig>قسم التنفيذ الجبري</orig>. For the record, we so announce.
Head of the Capital Enforcement Department <orig>رئيس إدارة تنفيذ العاصمة</orig>

## Second: Auction Conditions:
First: The auction shall begin at the base price. To participate in the auction, a payment of at least one-fifth of that price is required by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from a bank in favor of the Enforcement Department at the Ministry of Justice <orig>إدارة التنفيذ بوزارة العدل</orig>.
Second: The person whose bid is approved by the judge must deposit the full approved price, expenses, and registration fees at the time of the sale session.
Third: If the person whose bid was approved does not deposit the full price, they must deposit at least one-fifth of the price; otherwise, the auction will be reopened at their liability in the same session, based on the price at which the sale was awarded.
Fourth: If the bidder deposits the price in the following session, the auction will be awarded to them, unless another person comes forward in that session who agrees to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by a deposit of the full auction price. In this case, the auction will be reopened in the same session on the basis of this new price.
Fifth: If the first bidder does not deposit the full price in the following session and no one comes forward with a ten percent increase, the auction will be immediately reopened at their liability based on the price that was awarded to them in the previous session. In this session, no bid will be considered unless it is accompanied by a deposit of its full value. The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any shortfall in the property's price.
Sixth: The successful bidder shall, in all cases, bear the fees for the transfer and registration of ownership, the enforcement procedure expenses amounting to 200 K.D. <orig>د.ك</orig>, legal and expert fees, and the costs of advertising and publishing the sale in daily newspapers.

## First: Property Description: According to the attached description certificate.
The property under Deed No. 15386/2004, located in the Jabriya <orig>الجابرية</orig> area – Plot No. 673 – Block No. 9 – from Plan No. M/33479 B – with an area of 810 m2.
Note:
There is a violation, which is an overlook on the roof of the property made of light materials.

***Inspection:***
In the expert session dated 1/10/2022, a permanent visit was made to the property subject of the lawsuit in the Jabriya <orig>الجابرية</orig> area – Block (1) – Street (8) – Plot (673) – House (18), in the presence of the plaintiff in person, the defendant in person, the plaintiff's agent, and the attending expert from the administration, Mr. Abdulaziz Al-Dughaishem <orig>عبد العزيز الدغيشم</orig>. The inspection was conducted as follows:
1- The property subject of the lawsuit is in accordance with the general and special specifications of Deed No. (15386/2004) and has an area of (810) square meters.
2- The property subject of the lawsuit is a private residence located in the Jabriya <orig>الجابرية</orig> area – Block 9 – Street 8 – Plot 673 – House 18. It overlooks an internal street and an alleyway, and is bordered by a neighbor on the right and a neighbor on the left after the alleyway.
3- The property subject of the lawsuit is divided, with a main entrance for the plaintiff and a main entrance for the defendant, and a side entrance on the alleyway for the defendant. The main entrances overlook the street, and the property is separated internally.
4- The two parts belonging to the plaintiff and the defendant are identical on the inside, and each consists of a ground floor, a first floor, a roof, and a yard leading to the annex, with the following details:
- Ground floor consists of a hall + internal kitchen + washbasins + bathroom + two rooms + bathroom + marble flooring for the floor.
- First floor consists of a hall + master bedroom + preparatory kitchen + 4 rooms + two bathrooms.
- The annex consists of a servant's room + bathroom + storage room + main kitchen.
- The roof consists of: a room + bathroom + a roof area with machinery.
5- The exterior cladding of the property and the fence is Sigma.
6- The external yard for each part is separated by an internal fence, so there is a yard for the plaintiff and a yard for the defendant.
7- The property has central air conditioning.
8- There are shaded parking spaces for each part of the property; parking for the plaintiff and parking for the defendant.

## First: Property Description: According to the attached description certificate.
Property of Document No. 2014/6022 located in Funaitees <orig>الفنيطيس</orig> – Plot No. 70 – Block No. 5 – from Plan No. M/37882 – with an area of 400 m2.
Note:
There is a violation, which is the enclosure of a balcony on the second floor, and iron pergolas have been added to the roof.

### *Inspection:
In the session of 13/6/2022, a visit was made to the disputed property located in the Funaitees <orig>الفنيطيس</orig> area – Block 5 – Street 505 – House 46 – Plot 70 – House 40, Unit PACI No. 20402138. It was inspected on-site in the presence and guidance of the parties to the dispute and with the assistance of Mr. Khaled Al-Jariwi <orig>خالد الجريوي</orig>, an expert from the administration. The inspection was carried out as follows:
1. The disputed property has an area of 400m2 as per Document No. 6022, registered on 15/7/2014.
2. The disputed property is a residential plot located on a street and a side alley, with vacant land on another side and another house at the back. The exterior cladding is white and gray Sigma paint. The building's condition is new, and the finishing is very good. There are 3 entrances to the house, one main and two on the sides, and there are shaded parking spaces.
3. The disputed property consists of a basement, ground floor, first floor, second floor, and a roof (quarter floor), detailed as follows:
- a- The basement consists of 3 rooms, one of which is a master, + kitchen + living room + guest bathroom.
- b- The ground floor is one apartment consisting of 2 rooms + 2 bathrooms + kitchen + living room + guest bathroom.
- c- The first floor consists of a master room + its bathroom + a room + a bathroom + a living room + a kitchen + a guest bathroom.
- d- The second floor is identical in detail to the first floor.
- e- The roof is a quarter floor consisting of 2 bedrooms + kitchen + bathroom + a mechanical room (for air conditioning units, filters, and heaters).
4. There is an elevator, an outdoor garden, and central air conditioning.
5. The agent for the two plaintiffs stated that the house is not rented and that the first plaintiff's son lives in the basement, the second plaintiff lives on the ground floor, the first plaintiff's daughter lives on the first floor, and the defendant lives on the second floor. The roof is shared among the parties to the lawsuit. He also stated that construction began in 2016 and occupancy began at the end of 2018.
6. The house is in a clean condition, and the finishing is very good.
7. The defendant stated that there is no family relationship between the parties to the lawsuit.
8. Mr. Khaled Al-Jariwi <orig>خالد الجريوي</orig>, the expert, has inspected the property and taken notes in preparation for appraising its total value and submitting the relevant report.

## Second: Auction Conditions:
First: The auction shall start at a base price of (600,000 K.D.) six hundred thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>. To participate in the auction, a deposit of at least one-fifth of this price is required, payable by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from a bank in favor of the Enforcement Directorate at the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>.
Second: The person whose bid is approved by the judge must deposit, during the sale session, the full approved price, in addition to expenses and registration fees.
Third: If the person whose bid was approved does not deposit the full price, they must deposit at least one-fifth of the price; otherwise, the auction will be reopened at their liability in the same session, based on the price at which the sale was awarded.
Fourth: If the bidder deposits the price in the following session, the auction will be awarded to them, unless someone comes forward in that session who is willing to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by a deposit of the full auction price. In this case, the auction is reopened in the same session on the basis of this new price.
Fifth: If the first bidder does not deposit the full price in the following session and no one comes forward with a ten percent increase, the auction shall be immediately reopened at their liability based on the price that was awarded to them in the previous session. In this session, no bid will be considered unless it is accompanied by a deposit of its full value. The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any shortfall in the property's price.
Sixth: The successful bidder shall, in all cases, bear the fees for the transfer and registration of ownership, the enforcement procedure expenses amounting to 200 K.D., legal and expert fees, and the costs of advertising and publishing the sale in daily newspapers.
Seventh: This announcement is published in application of the law and at the request of those initiating the sale procedures and under their responsibility, without the Clerks' Department of the Court of First Instance <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig> bearing any liability.
Eighth: The successful bidder acknowledges that they have inspected the property in a manner that negates any lack of knowledge.

## Notice:
1- This sale announcement is published in the Official Gazette in accordance with Article 266 of the Civil and Commercial Procedures Law.
2- The judgment awarding the auction is subject to appeal within seven days from the date of its pronouncement, in accordance with Article 277 of the Civil and Commercial Procedures Law.
3- The last paragraph of Article 276 of the Civil and Commercial Procedures Law states: "If the person whose property was expropriated is residing in the property, they shall remain in it as a tenant by force of law, and the successful bidder is obligated to draft a lease contract in their favor for a similar rent."

### Inspection:
In the session of 12/12/2024, the expert visited the disputed property for an on-site inspection in the Sabah Al-Ahmad Sea City <orig>صباح الأحد البحرية</orig> area – Luluat Al-Khiran, Sector A1, Plot 413, with automated number 95101559, with the assistance of the appointed technical expert, Mr. Sabri Yousef Kharit <orig>صابري يوسف خريط</orig>, and in the presence of the plaintiff's representative. The remaining litigants failed to attend despite being properly notified. The inspection was carried out as follows:
- The disputed property is a plot of land consisting of a basement and 14 interconnected chalets, located on a single street and directly overlooking the sea from the other side. All chalets are coated with beige Sigma paint, and the total land area is 1876 square meters.
- There is a shared swimming pool among the chalets.
- There is a staircase leading to the basement, which extends along the length of the plot and consists of a locked room.
- The expert inspected Chalet No. 17, which consists of a private swimming pool for the chalet. The ground floor contains a bathroom, a living room, and a kitchen. The first floor consists of two bedrooms and a bathroom, and the second floor also contains two bedrooms and a bathroom. It also has a maid's room with its own bathroom.
- The expert was unable to inspect the interior of the remaining chalets.
- The representative present for the plaintiff decided to limit their claim to the valuation of the land and building, without estimating the rental income.
- The expert notes that the existing building on the land has violations as established in the letter from the Kuwait Municipality <orig>بلدية الكويت</orig> submitted to the expert in the session of 12/11/2024, Document No. 4.
- The appointed technical expert recorded his on-site observations in preparation for his report.

## Announcement of a Penal Judgment
The Ahmadi Court <orig>محكمة الأحمدي</orig>, in its session held on 30-11-2021,
in Case No.: 000890/21 - Ahmadi Court, Ordinary Misdemeanors
Police Station No.: (0000076/20 - Fahaheel) -
Automated Case No.: 212589930
Against the accused: Ram Audagar Das <orig>رام اوداجار داس</orig>
Nationality: Nepal, Civil ID No.: 290041509178
issued a judgment in absentia stipulating:
The court sentenced the accused to one month's imprisonment for the related charge attributed to him and ordered his deportation from the country after serving the sentence. The Public Prosecution hereby notifies the convicted person of this judgment and instructs all security authorities to enforce it in accordance with the provisions of Article 188 of the Code of Criminal Procedure and Trials <orig>قانون الإجراءات والمحاكمات الجزائية</orig>. It is noted that if a period of thirty-seven days, calculated from the day following publication, elapses without the convicted person challenging the judgment through opposition or appeal, the judgment will become final and enforceable against him.
Director of the Criminal Enforcement Prosecution <orig>مدير نيابة التنفيذ الجنائي</orig>

## Inheritance Inventory Announcement
Mrs. Shamlah Farah Mansour Al-Sayeh <orig>شمله فرح منصور السايح</orig> has applied to the Sharia Documentation Department, accompanied by two witnesses, namely: Ahmed Abdullah Hamoud Al-Tawhid <orig>احمد عبدالله حمود التوحيد</orig> (Kuwaiti nationality) and Fayez Abdullah Hamoud Al-Tawhid <orig>فايز عبدالله حمود التوحيد</orig> (Kuwaiti nationality), requesting an inheritance inventory for the deceased, Raziqiyah Sharif Mudhhi Al-Saqr <orig>رازقيه شريف مضحي الصقر</orig> [Kuwaiti nationality], who passed away on 22/4/2025. Her inheritance is limited to her adult daughters, who are (Intisar <orig>انتصار</orig>, Shamlah <orig>شمله</orig>, Intidhar <orig>انتظار</orig>, Ibtisam <orig>ابتسام</orig>, and Badriyah <orig>بدريه</orig>), with no other heirs than those mentioned.
The Department hereby announces this for a period of two weeks from the date of publication in the Official Gazette for two consecutive issues. Anyone who has any objection to the aforementioned should submit their objection to the Ministry of Justice – Sharia Documentation Department. After the expiration of the aforementioned period, the necessary procedures in this regard will be taken. This is announced for public information.
Director of the Sharia Documentation Department

# Ministry of Finance <orig>وزارة المالية</orig>
## Announcement of Sale by Sealed-Bid Auction, Auction No. (2472)
The Ministry of Finance <orig>وزارة المالية</orig> announces the sale of computer equipment and accessories, office furniture, office equipment, iron, wires, and other various materials out of service, by sealed-bid auction at the Fatwa and Legislation Department <orig>إدارة الفتوى والتشريع</orig>, according to the following details: –
1- Location for receiving the terms booklet and auction participation offer: Sharq - Headquarters of the Fatwa and Legislation Department <orig>إدارة الفتوى والتشريع</orig> – Financial Affairs Department - Treasurer's Office, from 15/06/2025 to 19/06/2025. Documents will be provided for a non-refundable fee of (20) Dinars <orig>دينار</orig>, payable at the cashier of the Fatwa and Legislation Department <orig>إدارة الفتوى والتشريع</orig>.
At the time of receiving the terms booklet, the bidder will sign a declaration and pledge to adhere to the specified deadline for submitting the offer to the Central Sales Committee at the Ministry of Finance <orig>وزارة المالية</orig>.
2- Inspection Date: (5) working days, from 15/06/2025–19/06/2025
Inspection Time: During official working hours (from 8:00 AM to 12:00 PM)
3- Location for receiving those wishing to inspect the auction items:
- Sharq - Headquarters of the Fatwa and Legislation Department <orig>إدارة الفتوى والتشريع</orig>
4- Date of Bid Submission and Envelope Opening:
- Bid submission on Sunday, 22/06/2025, at the Ministry of Finance <orig>وزارة المالية</orig> – Ministries Complex – Block 12 – Third Floor – General Warehousing Affairs Department – Central Sales Section, according to the time specified for the bidder by the Fatwa and Legislation Department <orig>إدارة الفتوى والتشريع</orig> (No offer will be accepted after the bidder's specified deadline has passed).
- Envelope opening and auction holding on Monday, 23/06/2025, at the Ministry of Finance <orig>وزارة المالية</orig> – Ministries Complex – Block 12 – Third Floor – General Warehousing Affairs Department.
- Announcement of the winning bidder on the Ministry of Finance <orig>وزارة المالية</orig> website on Monday, 23/06/2025.
- Return of checks to unsuccessful bidders on Tuesday, 24/06/2025.
- The certified check / bank guarantee shall be submitted in the name of the Fatwa and Legislation Department <orig>إدارة الفتوى والتشريع</orig>.
### Special Conditions for the Auction:
- The bidder must be a Kuwaiti establishment or company registered in the Commercial Register and with the Kuwait Chamber of Commerce and Industry <orig>غرفة تجارة وصناعة الكويت</orig>. A foreigner may participate provided they have a Kuwaiti partner or a commercial agent under a notarized contract. (Must attach: a copy of the Chamber of Commerce and Industry certificate, a copy of the company license, and a letter of authorization certified by the Chamber of Commerce and Industry, all of which must be valid).
- Kuwaiti individuals are permitted to participate in the auction (a copy of the Civil ID must be attached).
To receive the auction terms booklet: Contact Mr. Khalid Obaid Lafi <orig>خالد عبيد لافي</orig>, Phone:

## Announcement of a Sealed-Bid Auction
## Auction No. (2473)

The Ministry of Finance <orig>وزارة المالية</orig> announces the sale of furniture, computer equipment, electrical appliances, computers, a diesel power generator, an antenna, and antenna spare parts that are out of service, by sealed-bid auction at the Communications and Information Technology Regulatory Authority <orig>الهيئة العامة للاتصالات وتقنية المعلومات</orig>, according to the following details:
1- Location for receiving the terms booklet and auction participation offer: Al-Nukhba Tower next to the Liberation Tower – Qibla – Abdullah Al-Salem Street – Block 10 – Plot No. (900002).
- Procurement Department from 15/6/2025 until 19/6/2025. The documents will be delivered for a non-refundable fee of (50) Dinars <orig>دينار</orig> to be paid to the cashier of the Communications and Information Technology Regulatory Authority <orig>الهيئة العامة للاتصالات وتقنية المعلومات</orig>.
Upon receiving the terms booklet, the bidder will sign a declaration and undertaking to adhere to the specified deadline for submitting the bid to the Central Sales Committee <orig>لجنة البيع المركزي</orig> at the Ministry of Finance <orig>وزارة المالية</orig>.
2- Inspection Date: (5) working days from 15/6/2025 – 19/6/2025.
Inspection Time: During official working hours (from 9:00 AM to 12:00 PM).
3- Location for receiving those wishing to inspect:
a- Al-Nukhba Tower next to the Liberation Tower – Qibla – Abdullah Al-Salem Street – Block 10 – Plot No. (900002).
b- Jaber Al-Ahmad City – Block 5 – Street 70 – Plot No. (900072).
4- Date for submitting bids and opening envelopes:
- Bids are to be submitted on Tuesday, 24/6/2025, at the Ministry of Finance <orig>وزارة المالية</orig> – Ministries Complex – Block 12 – Third Floor – General Warehousing Affairs Department <orig>إدارة شؤون التخزين العامة</orig> – Central Sales Section, according to the time specified for the bidder by the Communications and Information Technology Regulatory Authority <orig>الهيئة العامة للاتصالات وتقنية المعلومات</orig> (No bid will be accepted after the bidder's specified deadline has passed).
- Envelopes will be opened and the auction held on Wednesday, 25/6/2025, at the Ministry of Finance <orig>وزارة المالية</orig> – Ministries Complex – Block 12 – Third Floor – General Warehousing Affairs Department <orig>إدارة شؤون التخزين العامة</orig>.
- The winning bidder will be announced on the Ministry of Finance <orig>وزارة المالية</orig> website on Wednesday, 25/6/2025.
- Checks will be returned to unsuccessful bidders on Sunday, 29/6/2025.
- Certified checks / bank guarantees must be submitted in the name of the Communications and Information Technology Regulatory Authority <orig>الهيئة العامة للاتصالات وتقنية المعلومات</orig>.

### Special Conditions for the Auction:
1. The bidder – establishment or company – must be Kuwaiti, registered in the Commercial Register and with the Kuwait Chamber of Commerce and Industry <orig>غرفة تجارة وصناعة الكويت</orig>. A foreigner may participate provided they have a Kuwaiti partner or agent who is a merchant under a notarized contract. (Must attach: a copy of the Chamber of Commerce and Industry certificate, a copy of the company license, and an authorization letter certified by the Chamber of Commerce and Industry, all of which must be valid).
2. Kuwaiti individuals are permitted to participate in the auction (a copy of the Civil ID must be attached).
- To receive the terms booklet: Please contact Ms. Farah Al-Shaya <orig>فرح الشايع</orig>, Phone: 55680817
- Auction Inspection Site Manager: Mr. Mohammed Al-Sahli <orig>محمد السهلي</orig>, Phone: 99997985
Central Sales Committee <orig>لجنة البيع المركزي</orig> at the Ministry of Finance <orig>وزارة المالية</orig> / Phone: (22481971).

# Announcement
Amounts Due from the Assessment under the Income Tax Law for Ortagadora Construction Industry Anand Trade LLC, Registration No: 150878
Further to our letter No. 3136 dated 22/7/2020 regarding the amounts due from you based on the assessment for the fiscal years ending on 31/12/2014, amounting to (10,764 K.D.), only ten thousand, seven hundred and sixty-four Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>ديناراً كويتياً</orig>. Therefore, please proceed with prompt payment by transferring the due amount to the Ministry of Finance <orig>وزارة المالية</orig> account at the Central Bank of Kuwait <orig>بنك الكويت المركزي</orig> (IBAN) No. (KW22 CBKU 0000 0000 0011 0061 70) or by bringing a certified check for the amount to the Ministry of Finance <orig>وزارة المالية</orig> – Tax Examination and Claims Department <orig>إدارة الفحص والمطالبات الضريبية</orig> at the Ministries Complex.
Otherwise, the Ministry will be forced to take legal action in this regard. We refer to the provision of Article Eight of the Income Tax Decree <orig>مرسوم ضريبة الدخل</orig> No. (3) of 1955, as amended by Law No. (2) of 2008, which stipulates the imposition of a fine of 1% for every thirty days of delay in payment, or any part thereof.

# Ministry of Social Affairs <orig>وزارة الشؤون الاجتماعية</orig>
## Announcement

The Ministry of Social Affairs <orig>وزارة الشؤون الاجتماعية</orig> announces Tender No. MOSA/1-2025/2026 for the Maintenance of Automated Systems to Support the Activities of the Family Care Department <orig>إدارة الرعاية الأسرية</orig> of the Ministry of Social Affairs <orig>وزارة الشؤون الاجتماعية</orig>, in accordance with the general and special conditions and technical specifications contained in the aforementioned tender documents. Establishments, companies, and institutions registered and approved with the Central Agency for Public Tenders <orig>الجهاز المركزي للمناقصات العامة</orig>, registered with the Central Agency for Information Technology <orig>الجهاز المركزي لتكنولوجيا المعلومات</orig>, and registered with the Ministry of Social Affairs <orig>وزارة الشؤون الاجتماعية</orig>, who wish to participate, should visit the Ministry of Social Affairs <orig>وزارة الشؤون الاجتماعية</orig> – First Floor – Tenders Section, for a non-refundable fee of (75 K.D.) seventy-five Dinars <orig>ديناراً</orig> to obtain the tender documents during official working hours, bringing with them the following documents:
- A copy of a valid registration certificate from the Central Agency for Public Tenders <orig>الجهاز المركزي للمناقصات العامة</orig>.
- A "To Whom It May Concern" certificate issued by the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig> stating that there are no holds on the practitioner's file.
- A copy of the registration certificate from the Central Agency for Information Technology <orig>الجهاز المركزي لتكنولوجيا المعلومات</orig>.
- A copy of the registration certificate from the Ministry of Social Affairs <orig>وزارة الشؤون الاجتماعية</orig>.
- A copy of a valid commercial license.
- A copy of a valid annual national labor percentage certificate issued by the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig>.
- A letter requesting participation in the tender, stating the address, telephone, mobile, and fax numbers, and the establishment's details, along with the name of the follow-up person.

The papers and documents mentioned in the items above must be submitted first to the Tenders Section at the Ministries Complex. Second, the purchase fee must be paid at the Ministries Complex – Financial Affairs Department <orig>إدارة الشؤون المالية</orig> – First Floor – Cashier Section – via K-NET electronic payment only. The tender documents can then be collected from the Tenders Section.
Please be advised that the deadline for submitting offers and bids (the closing day) is Sunday, 29/6/2025. They must be delivered to the Mirqab area – Ministries Complex – Ministry of Social Affairs <orig>وزارة الشؤون الاجتماعية</orig> – First Floor, at the office of the Assistant Undersecretary for Financial and Administrative Affairs <orig>الوكيل المساعد للشئون المالية والإدارية</orig>. The latest time for submitting the envelope into the bid box is exactly 12:30 PM. Any bid received after this time will not be considered. Bids shall remain valid for a period of (90) days from the date of opening the envelopes and bids.

# Public Authority for Agriculture Affairs and Fish Resources <orig>الهيئة العامة لشئون الزراعة والثروة السمكية</orig>
## Announcement
The Authority announces the issuance of Practice No. PAAAFR/MS/1/2024-2025 (A) for the provision of specialized technical personnel in information systems. Companies and institutions can obtain the practice document by submitting a letter expressing their desire to purchase the practice, signed by the authorized signatory of the company or institution, during official working hours from the Financial Affairs Department (Tenders Section) at the Authority - Al-Rabiya - Ghazali Street.

<table_caption>Tender Schedule and Fees for IT Personnel Services</table_caption>
<table>
| Preliminary Meeting | Closing Date | Price | Guarantee |
|:---|:---|:---|:---|
| 10 days after the date of publication in the Official Gazette (Kuwait Today / Al-Kuwait Al-Youm <orig>الكويت اليوم</orig>) | 20 days after the date of publication in the Official Gazette (Kuwait Today / Al-Kuwait Al-Youm <orig>الكويت اليوم</orig>). | 75/- K.D. | 3,000/- K.D. valid for (90) days |
</table>

The preliminary meeting will be held at 10:00 AM in the meeting hall at the office of the Director of the Information Systems Center Department.
- The deadline for submitting bids is 1:00 PM at the Authority's headquarters.
- The aforementioned fee is to be paid by a certified check or K-Net card.
- This practice is limited to companies and institutions specialized in this field and registered with the Central Agency for Information Technology <orig>الجهاز المركزي لتكنولوجيا المعلومات</orig> for the year 2025.
- Any reservations or inquiries regarding the aforementioned practice must be submitted within three weeks from the date of the announcement of the practice issuance, otherwise such requests will not be considered.
- A certificate of the company's registration with the Central Agency for Public Tenders <orig>الجهاز المركزي للمناقصات العامة</orig> must be submitted upon purchasing the practice documents.
- A certificate of fulfillment of the national labor percentage, issued by the Ministry of Social Affairs and Labor <orig>وزارة الشئون الاجتماعية والعمل</orig> and valid for one year, must be submitted upon purchasing the practice and submitting the bid.
- A certificate of the company's registration in the supplier registry of the Public Authority for Agriculture Affairs and Fish Resources <orig>الهيئة العامة لشئون الزراعة والثروة السمكية</orig> for the year 2025 must be submitted upon purchasing the practice documents.
- All documents must be submitted on a non-writable CD, except for the bid form and the initial guarantee, which must be submitted as hard copies.
- Not divisible.
- The bidder must attach a valid "To Whom It May Concern" certificate issued by the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوي العاملة</orig>, stating that there are no holds on the practitioner's file for government contracts registered with the Authority due to any of the violations mentioned in Article 10 of Law No. 6 of 2010 regarding work in the private sector. It should be noted that bids not including this certificate will be disqualified.
- This announcement serves as an invitation for interested practitioners, as interested companies have the right to attend the envelope opening session.
- Companies wishing to attend must coordinate with the relevant department before the day designated for the bid opening session and bring the following documents:
1- A copy of the Civil ID.
2- A copy of the signature authorization.
3- In the event that someone other than the authorized signatory attends, a written letter from the authorized signatory must be presented, delegating whomever they see fit to attend the session.
- Owners of small and medium enterprises are exempt from the fees for purchasing the documents, in accordance with the provision of Clause (13) of Circular No. 1/2023 regarding auctions in public entities.
- Owners of small and medium enterprises wishing to apply for the practice must attach to their bid a valid certificate issued by the National Fund for Small and Medium Enterprise Development <orig>الصندوق الوطني لرعاية وتنمية المشروعات الصغيرة والمتوسطة</orig>, indicating their accreditation as a small or medium enterprise.
- This announcement is an integral part of the practice documents.

Director General <orig>المدير العام</orig>

# Public Investment Authority <orig>الهيئة العامة للاستثمار</orig>
## Announcement
Regarding Practice No. (KH – 274/2025-2027)
Provision of Internal Messenger Services for the Public Investment Authority
The Public Investment Authority <orig>الهيئة العامة للاستثمار</orig> announces the offering of the above-mentioned practice to specialized local companies and institutions, in accordance with the terms and specifications contained in the practice and contract documents. These documents can be obtained from the Public Investment Authority <orig>الهيئة العامة للاستثمار</orig> – Department of Administrative and Financial Affairs and Personnel Affairs, during official working hours, starting from Sunday, 15/06/2025, for a non-refundable fee of (75 KWD) only seventy-five Kuwaiti Dinars. The deadline for submitting bids is Thursday, 03/07/2025, at 1:00 PM. Bids must be submitted at the Authority's headquarters (Sharq Area <orig>منطقة شرق</orig> – Plot 1, Street 201, Block 900028 – 22nd Floor – Office No. 2215) before the closing date.
Bids shall be valid for a period of (90) days from the date of opening the bid envelopes. The initial guarantee for this practice is (2%) of the bid value and must be valid for the entire duration of the bid's validity.
Companies wishing to participate in the practice must:
1. Pay the prescribed fees for purchasing the practice documents via a certified check in the name of the Public Investment Authority <orig>الهيئة العامة للاستثمار</orig>.
2. Provide a letter of authorization from the company to purchase the documents.
3. The company must be specialized in this field.

For inquiries: Telephone: 22227854

Those interested in purchasing must attend the auction site on the specified date, taking into account the following conditions of sale:
1. The Auction Sale Committee <orig>لجنة البيع بالمزاد</orig> may sell the goods in a single lot or in several lots, according to the circumstances of the sale.
2. The successful bidder shall be charged a brokerage commission of 2% of the sale price.
3. The successful bidder must pay the value of the goods via K-net payment only, in accordance with the assessment of the Auction Sale Committee <orig>لجنة البيع بالمزاد</orig>.
4. The successful bidder must remove the goods from the premises of the Bayt al-Mal <orig>بيت المال</orig> Supervision office promptly and within 5 (five) to 7 (seven) days after the auction is awarded to them. Otherwise, any goods will be seized and sold in the next auction if the successful bidder fails to remove them within the specified period.
5. Any buyer to whom the goods are awarded is prohibited from assigning or reselling them to a third party until after they have been removed from the premises of the Bayt al-Mal <orig>بيت المال</orig> Supervision office, which is under the Administration.
6. In the event that the goods are not sold for any reason in the auction, the Committee has the right to offer them for sale in the subsequent auction.
7. The Administration has the right to stop, postpone, or reschedule the sale at a later date in the event a suitable price is not obtained or for any reasons it deems contrary to its interests.

8. The Auction Sale Committee <orig>لجنة البيع بالمزاد</orig> may cancel or postpone the auction for any reason it deems appropriate.
9. As the goods will be sold in their current condition "as is," bidders must conduct an inspection to verify the condition, quality, and type of these goods at the aforementioned address during the auction sale.
10. In the event the winning bidder refrains from paying the sale price or a portion thereof, the General Administration of Customs <orig>الإدارة العامة للجمارك</orig> has the right to resell the goods at the bidder's expense. If the price does not reach the amount of the first winning bid, the bidder is obligated to pay the difference. In this case, the Administration has the right to bar them from participating in any future auctions. The Administration is not responsible for any handling or use of the sold goods that violates applicable laws and regulations.
11. This sale is conducted in accordance with the provisions of Law No. 10 of 2003 regarding the Unified Customs System and its organizing resolutions.

# Customs Instruction No. (25) of 2025
Regarding the imposition of definitive anti-dumping duties against imports into the Gulf Cooperation Council countries of sanitary ware products originating in or exported from the People's Republic of China and the Republic of India

**Director General of the General Administration of Customs <orig>مدير عام الإدارة العامة للجمارك</orig>:**
Further to Customs Instruction No. (34) of 2013 regarding the mechanism for implementing decisions related to measures for combating harmful practices in international trade within the Customs Union of the Cooperation Council for the Arab States of the Gulf <orig>مجلس التعاون لدول الخليج العربية</orig>, and pursuant to Law No. (110) of 2015 concerning the approval of the issuance of the Unified Law "System" on Anti-Dumping, Countervailing, and Safeguard Measures for the Cooperation Council for the Arab States of the Gulf "Amended" and its executive regulations, published in the Official Gazette "Kuwait Today / Al-Kuwait Al-Youm <orig>الكويت اليوم</orig>" on 24/01/2016, and based on the official bulletin of the Technical Secretariat Bureau for Combating Harmful Practices in International Trade <orig>مكتب الأمانة الفنية لمكافحة الممارسات الضارة في التجارة الدولية</orig> in Issue (52) dated June 1, 2020, concerning the imposition of definitive anti-dumping duties against the Council's imports of ceramic sinks (washbasins), washbasin pedestals, bathtubs, bidets, toilet bowls, flushing cisterns (siphons), urinals, and similar fixed sanitary fixtures, originating in or exported from the People's Republic of China and the Republic of India.
And based on the letter from His Excellency the Assistant Secretary-General for Economic and Development Affairs <orig>الأمين العام المساعد للشئون الاقتصادية والتنموية</orig> No. (M.D./2/31/11) dated 26/05/2025, which states that the Ministerial Committee <orig>اللجنة الوزارية</orig> issued its Decision No. (16) on May 19, 2025, adopting the recommendation of the Permanent Committee <orig>اللجنة الدائمة</orig> No. (61/13/G 2025), concerning the imposition of definitive anti-dumping measures against the Council's imports of sanitary ware products originating in or exported from the People's Republic of China and the Republic of India.
The following shall be implemented:
1. In addition to the customs tax "duty," definitive anti-dumping duties shall be imposed on imports into the GCC countries of ceramic sinks (washbasins), washbasin pedestals, bathtubs, bidets, toilet bowls, flushing cisterns (siphons), urinals, and similar fixed sanitary fixtures, falling under customs tariff headings (69101000; 6910900) of the Unified Customs Tariff of the GCC countries, originating in or exported from the People's Republic of China and the Republic of India.
2. The definitive anti-dumping duty shall take the form of an increase in the applied customs duties based on the CIF value <orig>القيمة (CIF)</orig> against the products under investigation, in accordance with the final dumping margins shown in the following table:

<table_caption>Anti-dumping duty rates for specific Chinese companies</table_caption>
<table>
| Country | Names of Foreign Producing / Exporting Companies | Dumping Margin as a Percentage of CIF Value |
|:---:|:---:|:---:|
| People's Republic of China | Guangdong Zhiru Technology Co. Ltd. | 35.6% |
</table>

<table_caption>Anti-dumping duty rates for sanitary ware companies from China and India</table_caption>
<table>
| Percentage | Company | Country |
|:---:|:---:|:---:|
| 38.7% | Huida Sanitary Ware Co. Ltd. | People's Republic of China |
| 33.8% | Guangdong Akit Sanitary Ware Technology Co. Ltd. |
| 37.5% | Cooperating companies not in the sample (Appendix) |
| 51% | Others |
| | Ariston Ceramic | Republic of India |
| 47.4% | Anchor Sanitary Ware Pvt. Ltd. |
| | Aimler Ceramic |
| 21.4% | Racy Sanitary Wares |
| 69.5% | Eros For Sanitarywares |
| 36.2% | Cooperating companies not in the sample (Appendix) |
| 83.4% | Others |
</table>
* Some companies may use abbreviations for certain terms in their names, such as: Limited: LTD • private: PVT •

3. The application of the duties shall commence 37 days after the date of publication of this decision in the official bulletin of the Technical Secretariat Bureau for Combating Harmful Practices in International Trade and shall be for a period of five years. That is, the definitive anti-dumping duties shall be applied for a period of five years starting from July 08, 2025.
4. The collected definitive duties shall be treated in the same manner as customs duties.
Based on the decision of the Financial and Economic Cooperation Committee at its 93rd meeting, which tasked customs administrations with implementing the customs-related aspects of the agreed-upon mechanism for executing decisions concerning anti-dumping measures and harmful practices in international trade.
The Directors General are kindly requested to instruct their respective specialists to adhere to the aforementioned decision and work towards its implementation starting from 08/07/2025.

**Director General of the General Administration of Customs <orig>مدير عام الإدارة العامة للجمارك</orig>**

## Announcement

Based on Article (19) of the Municipality's Decision No. (161/2009) concerning the classification, licensing, and registration of construction and demolition contractors in the Kuwait Municipality <orig>بلدية الكويت</orig>, which stipulates that a contractor may submit a request to the Municipality to cancel their registration before its expiration or to cancel their classification, and the committee stipulated in the first article of these regulations may issue its decision to that effect after the fulfillment of the following two conditions:-
1- The contractor's completion of all contracted works.
2- The lapse of (15) fifteen days from the date of publishing this request in the Official Gazette.
The cancellation of the license or registration shall result in the return of the bank guarantee submitted by the contractor, taking into account the last paragraph of Article (10) of this decision.
Accordingly, the Municipality appeals to anyone with any claims against the aforementioned contractor in relation to construction contracts concluded between them that have not yet been completed, or judicial liens in their favor due to violating contracting works or dues arising from the construction contract, to contact the Contractors Section at the Engineering Systems Department within a maximum period of fifteen days from this date. The Municipality will not consider any claims submitted to it after the specified period.
Director General of the Municipality <orig>مدير عام البلدية</orig>

## Announcement 62 / 2025

Tender No. A-2024/8-2025/2025 Maintenance of File Storage Machines at Kuwait Municipality <orig>بلدية الكويت</orig>
Kuwait Municipality <orig>بلدية الكويت</orig> announces the re-tendering of Tender No. A-2024/8-2025/2025 for the maintenance of file storage machines, in accordance with the general and special terms and specifications contained in the aforementioned tender documents, which can be obtained from the Tenders and Contracts Department (Procurement Monitoring), main Municipality building (Middle Building) – Fourth Floor, for a non-refundable fee of 75 K.D. (only seventy-five dinars).
All companies submitting a bid for the tender must send a representative to attend the public session for opening the submitted bid envelopes. Please note that in the event of non-compliance with attendance, the Municipality shall not bear any responsibility in this regard.
The deadline for submitting bids to the designated box at the Tenders and Contracts Department in the main Municipality – Minister's Building – Seventh Floor is exactly 12:00 noon on Monday, 7/7/2025. For inquiries, call 22401044. Bids shall be valid for a period of (90) ninety days from the date of opening their respective envelopes. The value of the initial guarantee shall not be less than 2% of the total value, in the form of a certified (bank) check or a bank guarantee letter of credit in favor of Kuwait Municipality <orig>بلدية الكويت</orig>, valid for the entire duration of the bid's validity. Please note that this tender is non-divisible.
If you wish to visit the Municipality, please schedule an appointment by visiting the link: www.baladia.gov.kw
For the Director General of the Municipality <orig>مدير عام البلدية</orig>

- Pursuant to the text of Article (29) of Law No. 49 of 2016 regarding Public Tenders, "a single person or a group of persons collectively may not register for classification under more than one name, nor submit more than one bid in a tender. This excludes alternative bids where the tender conditions permit their submission. However, a person who has a share in separate companies, where each company is independent in its legal personality, finances, engineers, employees, and general administrative structure, may register himself and each of his independent companies for classification. A bid from a tenderer who violates this article shall be considered null and void by law."
